div.p: Visualisation of the artificial predation experiment. Examples of the artificial moth targets made to match typica and carbonaria specimens show the components of the pastry body and the digitally colour calibrated paper wings. Statistical analysis was conducted to produce the non-parametric distribution plot of survival over time, using Kaplan–Meier estimation. Higher survival of targets matching typica moths than carbonaria moths were seen; graphically represented by the red dashed and solid blue lines, respectively ( n = 500; p < 2e −16)
